Class Filters

         if src(x, y) <= threshold
      src(x, y) := 0
 else
      src(x, y) := maxVal

      • SHARPEN_LAPLACIAN

        public static final int SHARPEN_LAPLACIAN
        Sharpen image using Discrete Laplace operator.

        Algorithm:

        1. Apply discrete Laplace operator to source image.
        2. Summarize source image with image from step 1.

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • noneLinearFilter

        public static void noneLinearFilter(Image source,
                    Image result,
                    Size kernelSize,
                    Point anchor,
                    int iterations,
                    int extrapolationType,
                    Operator operator)
        Implements Nonlinear filter.

        For each pixel on this image apply given operator. This operator get kernel values and put result into current pixel. For example, we have kernel size [4x4] and anchor (1, 1) for each pixel on image we select a field: 

         
     0 1 2 3
   +---------+
 0 | o o o o |
 1 | o x o o |
 2 | o o o o |
 3 | o o o o |
   +---------+
        And put this values into operator. Result of this operator set to current pixel.

        Some filters need kernel with only odd sizes and anchor only in the center (for example, Gaussian blur).

        Parameters:
        source - Source image.
        result - Result image.
        kernelSize - Size of kernel that will be used for image operation.
        anchor - Anchor of the kernel that contain the relative position of a filtered point within the kernel.
        iterations - Number of iteration this filter to source image.
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation on image border. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        operator - Operation that should get kernel on each step.

      • gradientFilter

        public static Image gradientFilter(Image image,
                   Jama.Matrix derivativeX,
                   Jama.Matrix derivativeY,
                   double scale,
                   int extrapolationType)
        Calculate gradient filter by X and Y dimensions.

        This method is useful for creation own gradient methods.

        Algorithm:

        1. Convolve aperture with kernel derivativeX and save result as Gx.
        2. Convolve aperture with kernel derivativeY and save result as Gy.
        3. Calculate gradient by formula G = SQRT(Gx2 + Gy2).

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        derivativeX - Derivative values for X-dimension. Should have same size as derivativeY.
        derivativeY - Derivative values for Y-dimension. Should have same size as derivativeX. Needed to normalize values of different derivatives.
        scale - Scale parameter.
        extrapolationType - Operation that implements to given kernel. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying gradient filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • linearFilter

        public static Image linearFilter(Image image,
                 Jama.Matrix kernel,
                 double div,
                 double offset,
                 int extrapolationType)
        Convolves an image with the kernel.

        Common-used method for apply linear matrix filter.

        For example, we have matrix kernel: 

         
     0 1 2
   +-------+
 0 | 1 1 1 |
 1 | 1 1 1 |
 2 | 1 1 1 |
   +-------+
        with div = 9 and offset = 0.

        For each pixels we select aperture (using extrapolation on the image borders): 

         
     0 1 2
   +-------+
 0 | o o o |
 1 | o x o |
 2 | o o o |
   +-------+
        and multiply each value from aperture to corresponding value from kernel. For example value in position (0, 1) from aperture will be multiply to value (0, 1) from kernel. Then all multiplied values are summarized, divided to div value and to the result added offset value.

        Result of this operations saved into output image into corresponding position.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernel - Kernel to perform convolution. Should have odd size both all dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        div - Coefficient to division.
        offset - Value to offset the result.
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation on image border. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying linear filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • separableFilter

        public static Image separableFilter(Image image,
                    Jama.Matrix kernelFirst,
                    Jama.Matrix kernelSecond,
                    double div,
                    double offset,
                    int extrapolationType)
        Implement separable filter (2 consistent linear transformations with first and second filter).
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernelFirst - Kernel to perform convolution at first step. Should have odd size for all dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        kernelSecond - Kernel to perform convolution at second step. Should have odd size for all dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        div - Coefficient to division.
        offset - Value to offset the result.
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation on image border. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying separable filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • laplacian

              int extrapolationType)
        Discrete Laplace operator.
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying Laplace operator. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

        public static Image laplacian(Image image)
        Discrete Laplace operator.

        Use Image.EXTRAPLOATION_REPLICATE by default.

      • edgeDetection

        public static Image edgeDetection(Image image,
                  int edgeDetectiontype,
                  double scale,
                  int extrapolationType)
        Edge detection algorithms.

        Based on gradientFilter(Image, Matrix, Matrix, double, int).

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        edgeDetectiontype - Edge detection type. Use Filters.EDGE_DETECT_*.
        scale - Scale parameter for values in result image.
        extrapolationType - Type extrapolation on image border. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying detecting edges filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • edgeDetection

        public static Image edgeDetection(Image image,
                  int edgeDetectiontype)
        Edge detection algorithms.

        Based on gradientFilter(Image, Matrix, Matrix, double, int).

        Use 1.0 as default scale and Image.EXTRAPLOATION_REFLECT as default extrapolation type.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        edgeDetectiontype - Edge detection type. Use Filters.EDGE_DETECT_*.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying detecting edges filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • edgeDetection

        public static Image edgeDetection(Image image)
        Edge detection algorithms.

        Based on gradientFilter(Image, Matrix, Matrix, double, int).

        Use EDGE_DETECT_SOBEL as default edge detection method, 1.0 as default scale and Image.EXTRAPLOATION_REFLECT as default extrapolation type.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying detecting edges filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • getGaussianKernel

        public static Jama.Matrix getGaussianKernel(int kernelSize,
                            double sigma2)
        Release Gaussian kernel (see Gaussian function) for Gaussian filter as a vector with size (width, 1).

        Used formula: 

         G(x) = alpha * exp{-(x2) / (2 * sigma2)}
        where alpha is a scalable parameter to sum(G(x, y)) == 1.0.

      • getGaussianKernel

        public static Jama.Matrix getGaussianKernel(int kernelSize)
        Release Gaussian kernel (see Gaussian function) for Gaussian filter as a vector with size (width, 1).

        sigma calculated automatically.

        Used formula: 

         G(x) = alpha * exp{-(x2) / (2 * sigma2)}
        where alpha is a scalable parameter to sum(G(x, y)) == 1.0.

      • getKernelSize

        public static int getKernelSize(double sigma)
        Return size of one dimension base on sigma value (see Gaussian blur).

      • getSigma

        public static double getSigma(int size)
        Return sigma base on size value of one dimension (see Gaussian blur).

      • gaussianBlur

        public static Image gaussianBlur(Image image,
                 Size kernelSize,
                 double sigmaX,
                 double sigmaY,
                 int extrapolationType)
        Gaussian blur.
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernelSize - Size of kernel for applying filter. Should have odd size for both dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        sigmaX - Sigma value by X dimension (see formula).
        sigmaY - Sigma value by Y dimension (see formula).
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying Gaussian blur filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

        kernelSize - Size of kernel for applying filter. Should have odd size for both dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying blur filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

        Apply morphology transformation to image.
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.

        morphologyType - Type of morphology filter. Use Filters.MORPHOLOGY_* parameters.
        iterations - Number of applying this filter to source image.
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying morphology filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

        kernelSize - Size of kernel for applying filter. Should have odd size for both dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!

        Returns:
        Image with result of applying morphology filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • threshold

        public static Image threshold(Image image,
              double threshold,
              int thresholdType,
              double maxVal)
        Threshold filter.
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        threshold - Threshold value.
        thresholdType - Threshold type. Use Filters.THRESHOLD_* parameters.
        maxVal - If current color value more than threshold, set this value.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying threshold filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • threshold

        public static Image threshold(Image image,
              double threshold,
              int thresholdType)
        Threshold filter.

        Uses Color.COLOR_MAX_VALUE by default maximal value.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        threshold - Threshold value.
        thresholdType - Threshold type. Use Filters.THRESHOLD_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying threshold filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • adapriveThreshold

        public static Image adapriveThreshold(Image image,
                      int blockSize,
                      int type,
                      double C,
                      double maxVal)
        Calculate adaptive threshold.
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        blockSize - Size of block for detection threshold value for current pixel.
        type - Type of calculating threshold value. Use Filters.ADAPTIVE_* parameters.
        maxVal - If current color value more than threshold, set this value.
        C - Constant subtracted from the mean or weighted mean. Should be in interval [0.0, 255.0].
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying adaptive threshold filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • adapriveThreshold

        public static Image adapriveThreshold(Image image,
                      int blockSize,
                      int type,
                      double C)
        Calculate adaptive threshold.

        Uses Color.COLOR_MAX_VALUE by default maximal value.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        blockSize - Size of block for detection threshold value for current pixel.
        type - Type of calculating threshold value. Use Filters.ADAPTIVE_* parameters.
        C - Constant subtracted from the mean or weighted mean. Should be in interval [0.0, 255.0].
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying adaptive threshold filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.
